fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces

Interface EventsExchangingI

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AtomicModelI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPlottingHIOA, AbstractWall, AtomicES_Model, AtomicHIOA, AtomicModel, BankModel, BasicCounterModel, BatterySensorModel, ClientGenerator, ClientGeneratorModel, ControllerModel, DependentCounterModel, HIOA_Consumer, HIOA_Generator, HIOA_Multiplier, InsideWall, NetworkModel, OutsideTemperature, OutsideWall, PortableComputerStateModel, ServerModel, ServerModel, ThermostaticHeater, Tic_ES_Model, TicModel, TicModel, WiFiBandwidthModel, WiFiBandwidthSensorModel, WiFiDisconnectionModel

    public interface EventsExchangingI
    The interface EventsExchangingI declares the method used to exchange events among atomic models.

    Description

    Black-box Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2023-11-02

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void storeInput(java.lang.String destinationURI, java.util.ArrayList<EventI> es)
      store external events imported from another simulation model.

    • Method Detail

      • storeInput

        void storeInput(java.lang.String destinationURI,
                java.util.ArrayList<EventI> es)
        store external events imported from another simulation model.

        Description

        The DEVS protocol proposes two ways to propagate events among models. The first way is to return the produced events to the parent coordination engine which passes them to a sibling or return them to its own parent coordination engine.

        Contract

         pre     destinationURI != null && !destinationURI.isEmpty()
 pre     getURI().equals(destinationURI)
 pre     es != null && !es.isEmpty()
 pre     es.stream().allMatch(e -> isImportedEventType(e.getClass())
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        destinationURI - URI of the destination model.
        es - imported external events to be stored.
